title: Bride who faked stag do to steal £11,000 from boyfriend narrowly avoids jail
text:
A "deceitful and callous" bride-to-be, who stole £11,000 from her fiance by forging flight tickets and hotel bookings for a fake stag do, has narrowly avoided jail.

Rachel Doran claimed to have booked a dream trip away to Ibiza for boyfriend Chris Mahone and 30 of his friends ahead of their wedding last year.

But when the stag party arrived at the airport they discovered the documents had been forged and no bookings had actually been made.

Instead Doran spent the cash on herself leaving Mr Mahone, 29, a nuclear process worker from Cumbria, heartbroken.

As Doran was handed a suspended sentence yesterday, her ex-fiance said he now found it hard to trust people because of the devastating deception.

The court was told that Doran and Mr Mahone were childhood friends who had met at school and went on to begin a relationship later.
description: A "deceitful and callous" bride-to-be, who stole £11,000 from her fiance by forging flight tickets and hotel bookings for a fake stag do, has narrowly avoided jail.
